comment_data.body: These can both be const.
Given that `CallControl.calls[friend_number]` is invariant, you could hoist it out of the loop here and in all other similar loops below.
I'd use `Call *call = &Cal...` here like in other places.
Can you make all of these `Call *const call = &...`? That way we don't need to consider that it may be reassigned later in the function and have a different meaning there.
We may also want to avoid the bit rate exceeding UINT32_MAX (although this will give a warning if you compile for ILP32).
This name is reserved for the C implementation (ISO C 7.1.3). I'd just use `CallStatus`.
I'm not a fan of multiple declarations on one line, but even less of a fan if the declarators declare names of different types, in this case `uint32_t` and `uint32_t[OPENAL_BUFS]`.
Are these used outside of this file?
Redundant ().
++type (but I guess I won't mention these any further. Maybe at some point we can throw tokstyle at this code.)
Old style declaration. Use `(void)`.
Use `!...` instead of `== false`.
`peer` shadows `peer` of different type. Prefer to use a different name for one of them (I'd rename the one on line 842).
This can be `static`.
Looks like no - they can be `static`.
These functions can also be `static`.
`a` and `b` are ptr-to-const. Please cast to another ptr-to-const.
cbend is never used.
frame_size is also never used. It's also a super confusing macro in and of itself, especially given that the name "frame_size" does appear quite often, but isn't this macro.
nit: 1 space too many.
add 1 space

comment_data.body: `(double)` is implicit in vararg passing (6.5.2.2p7).
You may want to use size_t here, or cast to `(int)` explicitly if you mean a conversion.
const?

`(void)`

If you don't put anything in the (), these become variadic functions, so we have no guards against accidentally passing parameters.
powf (and "f" functions in other places where you work with floats).
sumOfSquares seems to be against the naming standard in toxic. I see it's taken from qtox, but maybe adapt it a bit more to use toxic naming standards.
I feel like we should factor out this long a && b && c expression into a function and use it in these callbacks. WDYT?
Ah, they are all slightly different. Maybe factor out the 2 common bits?
On third read, it seems you can generalise these functions entirely and make each of them 1 line.

This violates MISRA C:2012 required rule 13.5: "The right hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not
contain persistent side effects". Up to you whether you want to comply, though.
Is there a nice way to avoid having the same "enable?:" 3 times, and also avoid the use of function pointers in the if-condition?
Can't generalise it after all (I misread things), and factoring out the common bits seems less useful now. Never mind.
Avoid implicit bool conversion: write `*stringed_device_list != '\0'`
`groupchats[self->num]` is used several times. Assign it a name?
I'd give a name to `&chat->name_list[i]` here (maybe also above), but it's borderline. What do you think?
I'd give a name to `chat->name_list[i]` here.
tmpnick? It took me a few seconds to figure out what "nck" means (is this a common abbreviation elsewhere in toxic?).
Move into for-init-decl?

All of this code runs exactly 0 or 1 times per call to this function. It's a bit unclear because it's part of the loop body. If you factor out the "find the peer" bit into a function, then the "act on the peer we meant" bit can be behind an `if`. You could also handle the case of "no peer found", if there is something useful to do there (perhaps assert if that can't happen? Or else just return if it's normal).
Redundant ().
Move to for-init-decl?

This goto doesn't seem worth it to me. There isn't any cleanup we're doing in the on_error part, and
```
print_err(self, "oh no something bad"); return;
```
is shorter than
```
error_str = "oh no something bad"; goto on_error;
```
while the latter costs more time to understand.
`video_bit_rate` doesn't exist when we build for `AUDIO` only (`!VIDEO`). Either make the existence of that unconditional or avoid its use when `!VIDEO`.
Let's leave these as is.
I'm not convinced by this goto stuff here either. Do you want to keep it?
Needs "self".

commit.message:
Rework audio device handling

We now have at most one input and one output device open at any time,
but can have multiple capture callbacks and multiple output sources.
